concept.title: Nesting bookmaps within ditamaps
concept.shortdesc: For complex collection structures, only use bookmap at the top level. Any nested maps should be ditamaps.

conbody.p: You should not nest bookmaps within ditamaps, as the structure will cause confusion for both processing software and for documentation authors.

If you need to re-use content from a bookmap inside a ditamap, then a lower-level ditamap should be nested in the bookmap, and that lower level ditamap re-used in the main ditamap. In fact, except for small documents, you should aim to have the top-level bookmap contain only map references, and no topic references.

section.title: Rationale

lq.reftitle: Bruce Nevin, OASIS DITA Technical Committee mailing list

section.lq: Now that <bookmap has been provided, my sense is that it should be thought of as hierarchically above <map>, and this usage of referencing <bookmap> from <map> should be prohibited or at least cautioned against, not least because of the issues you're raising.
